    The Dig Presents: Superhighway!

    27 Apr 2023

    The Dig Presents: Superhighway!

    We have as many roads in the United States as we have streams and rivers.

    Produced by Caroline Kanner and Jackson Roach, with original music by Jackson Roach. Edited by Liza Yeager and Mitchell Johnson, with editorial oversight from Daniel Denvir and Alex Lewis.

    Subscribe to The Dig Presents here.

    Support The Dig at Patreon.com/TheDig Guests: Chris Helzer, Lou Cornum, Chris Wells, Robert Moor, Emilie Snell-Rood, Ben Goldfarb, Leanne Betasamosake Simpson

    Bibliography (in order of appearance):

    A Field Guide to Roadside Wildflowers at Full Speed - Chris Helzer

    Car Country: An Environmental History - Christopher W. Wells

    On Trails: An Exploration - Robert Moor

    Snell-Rood Lab Crossings: How Road Ecology is Shaping the Future of Our Planet - Ben Goldfarb

    A Short History of the Blockade: Giant Beavers, Diplomacy, and Regeneration in Nishnaabewin - Leanne Betasamosake Simpson

    Who Belongs to the Land: An Essay on Camps, Blockades, and Indigenous Models of Remaking the World - Lou Cornum

    Further Reading (alphabetical):

    Barbed Wire: An Ecology of Modernity - Reviel Netz

    Being a Beast: Adventures Across the Species Divide - Charles Foster

    Between Space and Time: Reflections on the Geographical Imagination - David Harvey

    Black and Blur: Consent Not to Be a Single Being - Fred Moten

    Blue Highways: A Journey into America - William Least Heat-Moon

    Burma-Shave
    [A Commemorative History of The Minnehaha Free State and Four Oaks Spiritual Encampment]

    (https://cpezine.omeka.net/items/show/17) - Elizabeth Marie Egan

    Empire’s Tracks: Indigenous Nations, Chinese Workers, and the Transcontinental Railroad - Manu Karuka

    The Founding and Manifesto of Futurism  - F. T. Marinetti

    “Highway Hypnosis”

    “Hyperspace”

    Invisible-5

    Landscapes on a Train - Cole Swensen

    Latitudes - Catherine Wong and Max Vilgalys

    The Lure of the Local: Senses of Place in a Multicentered Society - Lucy R. Lippard

    Native Wildflower Requirements - Federal Highway Administration

    The Negro Motorist Green Book

    A Non-Euclidean View of California as a Cold Place to Be - Ursula K. Le Guin

    [Nothing But] Flowers - Talking Heads

    Operation Wildflower

    Our History Is the Future: Standing Rock Versus the Dakota Access Pipeline, and the Long Tradition of Indigenous Resistance - Nick Estes

    The Power Broker: Robert Moses and the Fall of New York - Robert A. Caro

    River of Shadows: Eadweard Muybridge and the Technological Wild West - Rebecca Solnit

    Roadside America - John Margolies

    Roadside Picnic - Arkady Strugatsky and Boris Strugatsky

    Slaughterhouse-Five - Kurt Vonnegut

    Song of the Open Road - Walt Whitman

    Silent Spring - Rachel Carson

    Speed and Politics - Paul Virilio

    Topics: Highways Infrastructure Ecology
    Guests: Caroline Kanner Jackson Roach
